What do our IT Business Analyst II’s do?

The Business Analyst provides strategic and tactical business analysis services to business partners within the organization. The focus of this position is to work closely with business units to gain in-depth understanding of the business strategy, processes, services, roadmap and the context in which the business operates. This role plays a key part in the organization’s understanding of current capabilities and the decision making for future capabilities needed to address business challenges. The Business Analyst is responsible for reviewing business processes at an enterprise level and analyzing assigned business processes end-to-end to identify and address operational, financial and technological risks. The Business Analyst is expected to identify opportunities to mitigate these risks, improve efficiency and achieve organizational goals. Responsibilities will include the full range of Business Analyst activities and involvement in large complex projects related to operational business functions.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to;

Demonstrate up-to-date expertise in IT Systems and apply this to the development and execution of improvement action plans by providing advice, guidance and best practices.

Support and align enterprise-wide efforts to meet customer and business needs.

Stay current with needs and strategies; utilizing formal and informal written communication methods (e.g. emails, PowerPoint presentations, executive updates, task lists, updates) to communicate updates and findings; and facilitating project meetings and presentations to all types of diverse audiences (e.g. senior management, Customers, technical staff).

Identify improvement opportunities (proactive and reactive).

Demonstrated fluency in business processes and process differentiation.

Elicit and clearly document business and systems requirements.

Serve as a liaison between Operational & Functional teams and IT to assist or gather business requirements needed for system modifications, enhancement and implementations.

Provide leadership to team members and peers by collaborating with others; articulating ideas and viewpoints to stakeholders, peers and others; identifying and initiating projects; managing resources; driving the resolution of issues; and holding self and team accountable for results.

Assess business process and system inefficiencies.

Identify, create and facilitate process design changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design at a moderate-to-complex level; focusing on quality improvement and data management; ensuring data is reliable and valid; developing process improvements or re-engineering and recommending elimination; integrating new systems and processes with existing ones; and partnering with internal and external customers to ensure systems provided meet the long-term business strategies.

Ability to analyze and synthesize business requirements, including recognizing patterns and conceptualizing processes.

Understand and negotiate needs and expectations of multiple stakeholders.

Perform gap analyses to evaluate multiple solutions and determine the scope from the optimum solution.

Identify ways to increase adoption and end-user satisfaction.

Provide and support the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes and new responsibilities.

Create and maintain project specifications, estimating time and resources, monitoring milestone completion, providing timely reporting of issues that impact project progress, coordinating actions and resolving conflicts.

Provide project level analysis – producing required project analysis documentation (business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, UAT plan).

Create and maintain issue logs, meeting minutes, meeting schedules, project summaries and updates.

Manage relationships and expectations by developing a communication process to keep others up-to-date on results of analysis, testing, and other project deliverables.

Lead or participate in multiple projects by completing and updating project documentation; managing project scope; adjusting schedules when necessary; determining daily priorities; ensuring efficient and on-time delivery of project tasks and milestones; following proper escalation paths; and managing supplier relationships.

Meet with the project team regularly to review project deliverables and deadlines.

Collaborate closely with developers to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during the QA process.

Develop and execute test plans.

Support system conversions, upgrades, enhancements.

Performs all other duties as assigned.

What do you need?

Bachelor’s required.

Minimum 4 years of BA experience.

Must have experience working on large scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational requests from multiple stakeholders.

Strong project management, ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at any given point.

Strong relationship building skills & communication skills.

Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills.

Understanding of Indices, fundamentals and analytical data, returns level data etc.

Data analysis and Process analysis.

Negotiation skills.

Systems and technical understanding.

Competent understanding of Business Operations.

Action-oriented - preferred.

Leadership - preferred.

Teamwork - preferred.

Client Management - preferred.

Ability to present information for decision making purposes with little-to-no direction - preferred.

Business Operations - preferred.

Acumen for Planning - preferred.

Strong time management, organization, and multi-tasking skills.

Must pass pre-employment background screen.

Must possess a valid driver’s license and pass motor vehicle record search.

Company Description
Stratas Foods LLC is the leading supplier of fats and oils to the Foodservice, Food Ingredients and Retail Private Label markets in North America and is a producer of quality bulk and packaged dressings, mayonnaise and sauces. Stratas Foods was formed in October 2008 as a 50/50 joint venture between ACH Food Companies (ACH) and Archer Daniels Midland (ADM).
Manufacturing facilities are located in Dallas and Houston, TX; Decatur and Quincy, IL; Englewood, NJ; Fresno, CA; Nashville, TN; and Valdosta, GA. Corporate offices are located in Memphis, TN. We are committed to maintaining a progressive workplace by utilizing the ideas, skills and talents of all of our employees. We strive to make Stratas Foods a great place to work and are building a team capable of meeting our business goals.

Job Description
The Trade Promotions Analyst is responsible for ensuring that Stratas trade, brokerage, label, marketing and promotional programs are properly established and maintained in the applicable systems, and for safeguarding company assets by promptly validating and processing payment and deduction data. This will be accomplished by maintaining accurate and orderly physical files and computer databases, and by facilitating the flow of payment and deduction processing through consistent and timely resolution.

Set up and maintain marketing/promotion items in the applicable system (trade rebates, brokerage, buying group rebates, MAP funds, operator promotions, label allowances, etc). Maintain applicable system/database to reflect and track deals offered by sales.
Research inquiries from customers and business partners related to promotional items, and communicate findings promptly.
Process and maintain applicable system or database for the preparation of payment requests for trade related items, and ensure approval is obtained before submitting to A/P for payment.
Receive incoming deduction documents and support from team members or customers for trade related items, and review to determine if the program has been set up. When support from the customer is not adequate, contact the customers to determine the nature/details of their claim and to obtain additional backup. .
Enter or review customer data in the applicable database to determine the validity of the customer’s claim and the related available accrual. Analyze database items for accuracy compared to customer deductions/payment requests, price changes, etc.
Prepare credit requests for items that are supported by existing trade programs. Resolve any discrepancies with Sales and/or customers.
For invalid trade deduction items, contact the customer to secure repayment providing necessary information to support the amount allowed by Stratas for the trade program.
Maintain deduction database information in the Blacksmith system, and maintain physical files of deductions currently open and in the resolution process.
Prepare reports as needed to track the status of payment requests and deduction balances, and to communicate progress to Stratas management. Develop/maintain reports to communicate trade spending information, accrual balances and to support monthly P/L variance analysis.
Other projects as requested by management to support the Finance department.

Qualifications*
Education:* Bachelor's degree in a business related field required or equivalent experience.
Related Experience: 1 - 3 years business experience. Experience in Customer Service, Sales/Marketing or Accounting/Finance is strongly preferred.
Equipment/Software Skills: Excellent knowledge of all Microsoft Office, database access, and spreadsheet programs (should be able to create formulas, link and summarize data, etc.) required. Must be able to quickly learn new system applications. Experience working with databases and exporting to Excel is preferred.
Competencies:

Problem Solving - Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations.
Oral Communication - Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listens and gets clarification; responds well to questions. Works well with both internal and external customers.
Judgment - Displays willingness to make decisions; Supports and explains reasoning for decisions; Makes timely decisions. Uses strong reasoning and negotiation skills to secure repayment from customers for invalid items.
Teamwork - Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit.
Strong organizational skills with an attention to detail and accuracy to document and trade promotion data

Additional Information*
Physical*: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and use hands for extended periods of time in front of a computer monitor and use a computer keyboard. The employee will also occasionally stand and walk to the copy room and throughout the building to interact with other departments.
Sensory: Close vision needed for working on a computer for long lengths of time. Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and in small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization. The noise level for this position is usually moderate.
Mental/Reasoning: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. This position requires a great deal of learning, reasoning and analyzing. Mental reasoning is required to analyze data for accuracy and validity.

ABS Group is a global company that provides data-driven risk and reliability solutions and technical services that help our clients enhance the safety, integrity, quality, and environmental efficiency of their critical assets and operations.

We work with our clients to develop risk and reliability-related solutions to meet their needs. Every day our multidisciplinary team of engineers, software developers, data scientists, data analysts, and cyber security specialists work together to develop innovative digital solutions for a wide range of complex challenges. If you are a motivated self-starter with intellectual curiosity, we’re just what you’re looking for.

The Risk Consultant/Data Analyst position will analyze data from internal and external sources to estimate risk and inform decisions for our clients. Projects will often support federal government clients who are on the front lines of reducing the negative impacts of both natural and man-made hazards on the American public. Analyses will involve critical thinking and moderate statistical analysis to unravel complex and often messy data. The ideal candidate is a team player, critical thinker, and problem solver who enjoys working in a dynamic, collaborative environment. This position will require moderate travel based on client and project needs.

Please note: T he ideal candidate for this role should be open to working our hybrid model. For the hybrid model, Monday– Thursday duties are performed out of our Knoxville office: 830 Corridor Park Blvd (830 Corridor Park Blvd, Knoxville, Tennessee 37932). Friday is remote eligible. The typical schedule consists of 40 hours per week. Open fully remote candidates in the DC Metropolitan area.

Translate client needs and project tasking into individual, actionable next steps
Research and identify available data sources to support decision-making

Use basic statistical tests to validate findings
Assess risk using mathematical risk models

Troubleshoot and debug errors

Contribute positive energy to the team
Communicate your work to small audiences (10-20 people)

Education and Experience

1 to 4 years of relevant work experience
Experience with two data analysis languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R, Stata)
Experience with enterprise data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau)
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, mathematics, economics, computer science, information management or statistics, or related technical field

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Advanced Excel experience (e.g. VBA, Query Editor/PowerQuery)
Geospatial analysis experience (e.g. ArcGIS, QGIS)
Experience in developing machine learning models (e.g., Python)
Gather and analyze data effectively.
Apply critical thinking to a wide variety of problems.
Comprehend and analyze complex problems.
Work under tight deadlines
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint,
Ability to obtain a working knowledge of the ABS Health, safety, quality, and environmental management systems.

Reporting Relationships:

This position reports to the Senior Program Manager.

The Digital Marketing Analyst will provide actionable insights to optimize our growing ecommerce business through the analysis of digital marketing channels like websites and social media. Utilizing tools and data sources like Google Analytics, Tableau, and ad accounts, the role will answer crucial business questions regarding digital marketing and ecommerce impact. The candidate will employ statistical, machine learning, and data mining techniques to model complex issues, discover insights, and identify opportunities. This individual will be adept at delivering strategically relevant insights for informed decision-making, working closely with stakeholders across the business to ensure optimal decision-making at every level.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Source valuable data from a wide range of digital measurement systems (GA4, Shopify, Facebook, Google, Tableau, CDP), including real-time and large-scale sources, harmonizing and automating collection processes where applicable
Implement an automated system for data extraction and analysis to efficiently monitor sales, digital acquisition, and retention across digital marketing, CDP, and ecommerce platforms where relevant.
Proactively using GA4 to identify what sources of traffic are working in converting on web or other channels and where there are opportunities to improve.
Develop data-driven insights that enable the organization to optimize and remove friction points along the digital journey.
Analyze data to discover trends and patterns in how audiences engage with our digital content, our owned social channels and our website.
Decode the behaviors embedded deep into data sets using machine learning and advanced statistical algorithms.
Able to derive the “so what” from models and support the development of compelling stories that facilitate action and drive growth.

Education/Experience Requirements

Education: Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Finance, Computer Science, Marketing, Business or a related field or 4-6 years in digital analytics.
Experience: Experience with Web Analytics and eCommerce/Direct To Consumer business, including1-3 years analyzing data for an eCommerce leader, national manufacturer, or CPG brand
Strong analytical skills, ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendation.
Advanced proficiency in Excel required.
In-depth experience with website analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Tableau, DOMO, Big Query, )
Moderate proficiency in Python or R programming language for data analysis and SQL for data collection and extraction

Special qualifications or skills

Expertise in Digital Measurement Tools: Proficiency in Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Shopify, Facebook Insights, Google Ads, Tableau, and Customer Data Platforms (CDP).
Data Collection and Harmonization: Ability to collect data from multiple sources, harmonize it, and automate data collection processes.
Data Analysis Skills: Strong skills in quantitative analysis, including identifying patterns and trends, and the ability to generate actionable insights from large datasets.
Sales and Acquisition Tracking: Proficiency in creating and managing systems for tracking sales, digital acquisition, and retention across multiple channels.
Digital Marketing Expertise: In-depth knowledge of digital marketing strategies, conversion optimization, and traffic sources.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Ability to use data-driven insights to optimize and remove friction points along the digital journey.
Audience Engagement Analysis: Experience in analyzing how audiences engage with digital content, social media channels, and websites.
Storytelling and Presentation Skills: Ability to convert data insights into compelling narratives that drive action and growth.
Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to proactively identify and address challenges based on data insights.
Communication Skills: Strong ability to communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: Ability to work meticulously with large amounts of data to ensure accuracy.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver results on time.
Continuous Learning: Willingness to stay updated with the latest trends and best practices in digital analytics and marketing.
Customer-Centric Mindset: Ability to understand the customer journey and optimize the digital experience for customers.

Financial Analyst

Company Overview

With approximately $800 million in revenue, The Carlstar Group, LLC (“Carlstar” or the “Company”) is a leading producer of specialty tires, wheels, and assemblies for diverse end markets including: lawn & garden, construction, power sports (primarily all-terrain vehicle tires), trailers, and agriculture.

Carlstar (and its predecessor) have been in the engineered rubber products business for over 100 years and sells its products under many of the most recognized brand names in their respective market segments including Carlisle, ITP, and Cragar, among others. In addition, the Company has one of the broadest distribution channels and the largest installed bases within its served North American markets. The Company is a strategic supplier to leading OEMs such as John Deere, Polaris, Husqvarna, Stanley Black & Decker, and BRP, and is sole sourced on a number of their leading platforms. Approximately 59% of Carlstar’s revenue is derived from higher margin aftermarket sales, leveraging the Company’s large installed base of OEM products. Carlstar has approximately 3,400 employees and operates four manufacturing facilities in both North America and China and twelve distribution centers.

Carlstar is engaged in serving lower volume, higher mix business where the Company must economically manage thousands of SKUs with low individual order quantities through a complex distribution network in a marketplace that highly values timely and accurate order fulfillment.

Through the implementation of efficient operational (enhanced SIOP, lean manufacturing, inventory planning, optimization of the distribution network, redesign and value engineering of compounds and products, improved process control, activity based costing, etc.) and intelligent commercial (dynamic pricing and material margin management, new product development, refined channel management, new account conquests, etc.) strategies, the company is targeting improving performance to over 12% EBITDA margins on substantially higher revenue over time. The company is on a very strong performance trajectory today.




To learn more about The Carlstar Group, please visit the company’s web site: https://www.carlstargroup.com/.




Position Summary:

The Financial Analyst supports the Director of Financial Planning & Analysis in providing reliable and robust financial analysis and reporting to support the Executive Leadership Team, controllers, departmental leaders, and company strategic initiatives and projects.

The Financial Analyst focuses on providing insights and clarity of results and/or questions through their analysis of financial and operations data, development of financial models, and monthly reporting. The Analyst will not only analyze data but also think strategically while connecting the analysis to the broader goals and strategies of the organization. The Analyst will need to excel at being part of a cross-functional organization working alongside team members to drive results and clarity so that business decisions can be made quickly and effectively. With this responsibility, the Analyst will need to have a strong focus on accuracy, continuous improvement, and personal drive for high-quality results.

This position reports to the Director of Financial Planning and Analysis




Pivotal Experience and Expertise:

Carlstar seeks an action-oriented, self-driven, Financial Analyst, who has demonstrated strong leadership, a problem solver and has an analytical mindset. A proven track record as an accounting professional.

Develops and provides reliable and robust financial reporting for the commercial, procurement and operational teams
Responsible for preparing, consolidating, and analyzing financial and operations data provided by respected teams.
Supports manufacturing and corporate finance teams during monthly close process
Supports development of monthly financial packages and operations reporting for Executive Leadership Team
Responsible for preparing, reporting, and monitoring of SG&A department spending
Financial team member for SIOP (Sales, Inventory & Operations Planning) process
Develops, reviews and updates tools to identify growth and complexity reduction opportunities using the 80/20 principle (i.e., Quad Methodology)
Supports development of Annual Operating Plan working with cross-functional team
4-year degree in accounting, finance, business administration, or related field required
Continued education (MBA, CMA, or CPA) preferred
1 to 3 years of experience preferred in similar finance role
Advanced PC Skills - Mid-Advanced Excel preferred
Experience implementing and driving continuous improvement in an organization
Willingness to travel - 10%



Leadership Capabilities & Culture Fit:

Unquestionable integrity, ethics, and judgment. The courage and ability to take a strong position when required for the good of the Company.
Ability to practice at a high level of confidentiality
Excellent communication and influencing skills. The ability to be collaborative and drive progress and the ability to translate complex business and operational issues in terms readily understandable to a broad audience.
Results-oriented, self-starter, with a strong track record of achieving excellent results with minimal supervision
A team player, who can work well with other departments across the organization at all levels
Models a Growth Mindset, learning from success and failure
Strong interpersonal communication skills. An ability to positively engage with people at all levels of the organization
Strong analytical, creativity and problem-solving skills. Possesses an intellectual curiosity to probe and understand how the dimensions within their area of responsibility work and influence the broader business.
Clear and concise oral and written communication skills
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to prioritize work
He or she will embrace a philosophy of transparency, healthy debate and accountability

Job Summary and Qualifications

JOB SUMMARY

The Consulting Product Analyst position is responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating business systems and user needs of applications/products supported by the IT&G REBA Product Development team. The individual would leverage analysis to recommend system and business process modifications to support business strategies through purchased or in-house developed software. Analyst must be able to write detailed description of business goals, user needs, computer program functions, and steps required to develop or modify computer programs with minimal supervision. Position requires detail knowledge of requirements gathering and documentation practices, as well as software development methodologies

An analyst would communicate requirements to software developers and assures that the designed solution will meet business and user needs. Critical to the success of this position is a proven ability to work with and develop rapport with multiple business partners while resolving conflicts, developing project timelines, managing risks, and assisting in the development of quality assurance test plans and development of end user documentation.

Must work with project team of developers/QA analysts on features, enhancements, and fixes as required. Will serve as 2nd tier escalation points for issues related to system functionality. A background in What-if modeling or Managed Care contracts or revenue cycle is desired but not required.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITES

Requirement Gathering and Documentation

Performs the set of tasks and techniques to understand the business needs of the department\organization.

Development and execution of requirements gathering process

Facilitate and document requirement gathering meetings with business users

Prioritize requirements and create conceptual prototypes and mock-ups

Provide expertise in process design and provide leadership in communicating requirements to product development, testing, and education/training.

Support business requirements detailed documentation

Participates in user acceptance testing and testing of new system functionality

Supports application training documentation creation

Direct quality measures for department deliverables

Participate in peer reviews of analyst work completed by team members

Build strong relationships within the department and company, including business owners

Participate in the day-to-day support and requirement gathering activities

Thoroughly understand assigned Business applications and user impact

7+ years of relevant work experience required

1+ years of management experience required

Bachelor’s degree preferred

OTHER/SPECIAL QUALIFICATIONS

Experience and/or knowledge of CMS Pricing Transparency initiative will be preferred but not required
SQL experience and proficiency
Strong relationship management skills
Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Highly motivated and able to work independently with general supervision
Sense of responsibility and accountability; someone who takes ownership and initiative
The ability to think and act; decisiveness, assertiveness, with the ability to achieve results quickly
Adaptable and flexible, with the ability to handle ambiguity and changing priorities
Professional demeanor and positive attitude; customer service orientation
Excellent time management skills
Detailed oriented and analytical with good organization skills
Ability to learn, understand, and apply new technologies, methods, and processes
Respect for diversity of experience, characteristics, viewpoints, and opinions

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORKING CONDITIONS

Some travel will be required – 10% or less

Typical work week hours can vary depending on workload and project deliverables

Duties

Manages the administrative aspects of all technical support programs. (Quality Assurance, Airspace & procedures, training, etc.) Provides management with advice and counsel on the operation of technical support systems for implementation, and planning purposes. The Incumbent performs a variety of technical functions independently and ensures that all required content is reviewed and prepared in a prescribed timeframe.

Applies experience and advanced knowledge of analytical and evaluative methods, techniques and concepts to plan and accomplish assignments. Responsible for the analytical activities to provide management with accurate, timely and authoritative information to enable decisions. Uses quantitative methods and techniques to assists more-experienced analysts in creating comprehensive reports from data and analysis as requested by management. Performs data analysis and synthesis of large databases. Conducts analyses in the review and evaluation of program activities. These analyses are conducted to ensure proper program integration and conformance to policy, completeness, and adequacy of operations in meeting goals and objectives. Prepares recommendations based on such reviews and discusses recommended courses of action with program managers to resolve major problem areas. These recommendations include but are not limited to financial, programmatic interfaces, and impact of not meeting goals and objectives. Establishes and maintains a tracking system, ensures facility orders and notices pertaining to technical programs and evaluations are current. Assists in the training and instructions to all personnel as necessary Plans, develops, monitors and executes all actions required to assist in the management of the various technical programs. Incumbent collects and analyzes data, prepares responses and works with management on BU requests. Work is reviewed frequently during assignments and at completion to ensure timeliness, policy compliance, and alignment with the requirement s of projects and/o r other work activities. Work activities typically support activities of the organizational unit, and may affect project/program objectives for the major subdivision and the LOB/SO. In some specialties, the work may affect internal and external customers. Established policies/procedures provide guidance for most assignments but allow some discretion for incumbent to select the most appropriate approach (es). Typically receives guidance on selecting approaches from a manager, team lead, or more experienced professional.

FV-G: To qualify at this level you must demonstrate that you possess at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to FV-F FG/GS-5-9. Experience in preparing a variety of graphic materials to be used for statistical, administrative or information purposes, as well as graphs, charts maps, diagrams, facility and equipment layouts, flow charts, floor plans, schematics and function charts.
Experience and /or knowledge in fulfilling requests from multiple lines of business (LOBs) such as Flight Standards, FAA Litigation, NTSB, FOIA, Flight Service, SERCO, National Weather Service (NWS), FAA Automation, Tech-Ops, ATO Safety Group.
Serve as subject matter expert (SME) for several different automation applications/tools to review and investigate incidents such as MiroEARTs radar data, SatoriM playback tool, FALCON playback tool, Camtasia, Digital Audio Legal Recorder (DALR), ADS-B Performance Monitor, and SkyReplay for the ATOP system. Experienced in CEDAR for all Memphis AT facilities and frequently troubleshoots technical issues for the workforce. Utilizes AAP Portal, Business Objects, Knowledge Services Network (KSN), Huddle, AISR, Defense Internet NOTAM Service. Tests, troubleshoots, analyzes, and makes recommendations for the FALCON with ADS-B development and testing. Tests, troubleshoots, analyzes, and makes recommendations on the FALCON for MEARTS testing. Enables the development team to finalize a FALCON playback tool that can be used for MEARTS radar and include ADS-B tracks that can be used across the NAS as well as other MEARTS facilities.

If you are requesting consideration for any of the special hiring authorities, you must submit the following documentation:


30% or More Disabled Veteran Program: You must submit a DD 214, Certificate of Discharge (Member 4 copy is preferred), and supporting documentation as required by form SF-15 such as an official statement, dated 1991 or later, from the Department of Veterans Affairs or from branch of the Armed Forces certifying to the present existence of the veteran's service-connected disability.

Persons with Disabilities and Persons with Targeted Disabilities Appointment: You must provide proof of disability documentation (i.e. Schedule A Letter) that: May be a letter or other documentation on official stationery/letterhead with an official signature. It must clearly states that you are eligible for appointment under the PWD/PWTD hiring authority or a Schedule A appointment authority as outlined in 5 CFR Section 213.3102(u). It does not need to detail the specific disability, medical history, or need for accommodation.


All Veterans: If you are claiming veterans' preference, you must submit either a DD Form 214 Certificate of Release or Discharge from Active Duty (Member 4 Copy or equivalent), or a document from the armed forces certifying that within 120 days you are expected to be discharged or released from active duty service under honorable conditions. If you are claiming 10 point preference, you must also submit a completed SF-15, Application for 10-Point Veteran's Preference, and supporting documents outlined on the SF-15. Documents must be uploaded or faxed to the Servicing Human Resource Management Office listed in this announcement and all documents must be received by the closing date of the announcement. If you fail to submit documentation, you will be assessed as a non-veteran.

If you are claiming 10 point preference but fail to submit the supporting documents outlined on the SF-15, you will be tentatively assessed as a 5 point preference eligible provided your DD Form 214 reflects that you have the service required to qualify for preference. Documents must be uploaded or faxed to the Servicing Human Resource Management Office listed in this announcement and all documents must be received by the closing date of the announcement. If you fail to submit documentation, you will be assessed as a non-veteran.

Veterans currently on active duty claiming veterans' preference: You will be granted tentative preference if you submit a document from the armed forces certifying that within 120 days you are expected to be discharged or released from active duty service under honorable conditions and your application shows that you have the required service. Prior to being appointed, you must provide to the Servicing Human Resource Management Office a DD Form 214 documenting discharge/release and showing that the service was honorable or general. If you are on terminal leave, you must provide documentation certifying authorized terminal leave.


If you are relying on your education to meet qualification requirements:

Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education in order for it to be credited towards qualifications. Therefore, provide only the attendance and/or degrees from schools accredited by accrediting institutions recognized by the U.S. Department of Education.

Failure to provide all of the required information as stated in this vacancy announcement may result in an ineligible rating or may affect the overall rating.

Your role

Are you solution oriented? Are you self-motivated and driven, with the ability to make the right call based on your own analysis work? We’re looking for someone like this who can work within our IB Business Risk Management – Client Complaints and Travel and Expense Team specifically to:

perform day to day tracking, coordination and prioritization of the business requests and deliverables as it relates to Travel and Expenses and Complaints
effectively deliver tasks assigned accurately and on time, and provide assistance and cover for other team members
work closely with and establish effective communication channels with key stakeholders, SME's and clients to gather complaint requirements, specifications and limitations in order to develop state of the art reporting capabilities.
offer exceptional customer service to our employees, addressing inquires and issues promptly and professionally
analyze complaint data to identify root causes and systemic issues
review and process employee expense reports, ensuring compliance with company polices
educate employees on policy compliance and assist them with expense report submissions
collaborate with various departments to validate and approve expense claims
stay up to date with company travel and expense policy and communicate changes when necessary


Your team

You will be working in the Complaints and Travel and Expense Team in Nashville, TN. We play a critical role in ensuring that our employees have a seamless and efficient experience when managing travel arrangements, expense reporting and filing complaints. Our attention to detail and dedication to compliance with company polices and industry regulations will contribute to the success and reputation of UBS.

Your expertise

ideally 1-2 years+ of relevant experience in a financial services environment (preferably within a Logistics & Control function), and/or in a business management support role
good presentation and interpersonal skills with an ability to work well with others
strong work ethic with demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities and deliver to deadline
eager to solve problems both by yourself and working with others
good analytical, problem solving and organizational skills
experience of using Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word skills
experience with SAP, Tableau or Alteryx, a plus
an understanding of operational risk frameworks and controls

About us

UBS is the world’s largest and the only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors..

We have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries.

Join us

At UBS, we embrace flexible ways of working when the role permits. We offer different working arrangements like part-time, job-sharing and hybrid (office and home) working. Our purpose-led culture and global infrastructure help us connect, collaborate, and work together in agile ways to meet all our business needs.

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves. Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?

Disclaimer / Policy Statements

SALARY: $20.00 TO $24.00 hourly


SUMMARY

The Inventory Control Analyst manages inventory quantities through the warehouse management system (WMS) and provides resolution for inventory discrepancies between WMS and the actual physical existence of inventory by performing investigation and research in the Company’s database and physical inventory counts to meet distribution demands. Responsibilities include writing reports, identifying, and analyzing discrepancies in the inventory data, performing and validating inventory counts when required, and monitoring the execution of and improving the inventory control system and processes in place.




ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.




Perform physical inventory counts of specific SKUs and warehouse locations daily
Identify discrepancies between inventory physically at locations and quantities in the Company’s database
Enter data for quantities of product issued and transferred between locations, inventory, and cycle count adjustments, into a computer database
Receive and issue finished goods into the computer database
Prepare monthly reports of count results and highlight major process issues identified during daily cycle count
Follow ISO/TL9000 requirements as it pertains to the position

SKILLS

Strong written and verbal communication skills; able to read, write, and speak in English
Problem-solving skills; able to analyze data and track inventory movement
Strong time management skills; able to multi-task
Able to work in a team environment
Organized, detail-oriented
Able to prioritize effectively; able to learn quickly and follow detailed instructions



SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY

This position has no supervisory responsibilities


WORK ENVIRONMENT

This position operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and filing cabinets.




This position also works in a warehouse/distribution center setting, with some outdoor exposure during the workday.




While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to fumes or airborne particles, moving mechanical parts, and vibration. The noise level in the work environment and can be loud. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, and photocopiers, and standard warehouse equipment such as hand trucks, box cutters and tape dispensers.


PHYSICAL DEMANDS

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, and maneuver around pallets. The employee is occasionally required to sit and climb or balance. The employee must regularly lift and/or move objects more than 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
POSITION TYPE AND EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK
This is a full-time position. Normal business days are Monday through Friday. Work hours will be assigned in advance.



TRAVEL

No travel is expected for this position.




REQUIRED EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE

High school diploma, or GED
Computer proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, and Word & strong in Excel
Minimum 1 year of physical inventory count
Experience with warehouse management and accounting systems
The ability to operate a scissor lift or PIT equipment is a MUST



OTHER DUTIES
Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Title: Project Analyst - 3375
Function: Project Management
Position Type: Regular, Full-Time
Pay Type: Exempt
Grade: 31/32
US Citizenship Required: Yes

This opportunity is being offered by National Aerospace Solutions, the team selected by the U.S. Air Force to conduct Test and Operations Sustainment at the Arnold Engineering Development Complex (AEDC), Arnold Air Force Base, Tennessee. National Aerospace Solutions is a limited liability company comprised of Bechtel National Inc. (as lead company) and Sierra Lobo Inc. with teaming Subcontractors nLogic Inc. and Chugach Federal Solutions Inc. AEDC operates more than 55 aerodynamic and propulsion wind tunnels, rocket and turbine engine test cells, space environmental chambers, arc heaters, ballistic ranges and other specialized units located in six states. Many of the complex's test units have capabilities unmatched elsewhere in the United States; some are unique in the world. AEDC is one of three installations which are part of the Air Force Test Center (AFTC), one of six subordinate commands of the Air Force Materiel Command organization and an important national resource.

AEDC’s mission is to conduct developmental test and evaluation for the Nation through modeling, simulation, ground, and flight test. Execution of the mission requires a large team of highly qualified and dedicated professionals from multiple technical disciplines to effectively accomplish the objectives of our test customers.

Job Duties:
Support the Project Managers managing large and complex capital improvement projects in an assigned branch.
Prepare and provide reports for that assist the Project Managers with tracking and control of the scope of work, resource utilization, schedules, and work accomplishments.
Collect and analyze data for trends and clearly communicate this information to Project Managers.
Perform cost and performance measurement analysis against planned and estimated scope under the supervision of the Project Managers.
Support preparation of Project Plans and associated documents such as using cost, schedule, and performance objectives, resource plans, verification and validation and risk management plans
Evaluate Earned Value Management System (EVMS) reports under the supervision of the Project Managers.
Assist Project Managers and other Branch personnel with the Configuration Status Accounting process.
It is a condition of employment to wear PPE (Personal Protective Equipment) in accordance with supervisory direction and company policy.
Perform other related duties as required.



Basic Qualifications:
BA/BS in business or related technical field from an accredited university and 0 to 3 years of relevant experience or any equivalent combination of relevant education and experience.
Current U. S. Citizenship is required.

Preferred Qualifications:
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strong Microsoft Office skills.
Basic knowledge of construction, engineering, procurement, or other project-related activities.
Basic knowledge of earned value management system (EVMS)
Basic knowledge of project cost and schedule performance monitoring tools such as Microsoft Project or Primavera P6
Ability to organize and monitor a wide variety of team efforts to their successful conclusion.
Ability to adjust promptly and effectively.



Due to Air Force Security requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required for employment at AEDC.

Position Summary
The Sr. Benefits Analyst (BA) will partner with the Director of Benefits in the day-to-day needs of the business. Typical functions include but are not limited to gathering and auditing benefit information along with experience reports and billing. Also, responsible for a wide variety of benefits administration related functions including health, dental, vision, life, disability, leave of absence, and COBRA. The BA will track, analyze, and evaluate benefit procedures and makes recommendations to management to improve quality and efficiency within the Benefits Department.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Develop and maintain key metric dashboards for the Benefits Department within the company's HRIS system.
Gather benefits data to audit and validate enrollments and changes throughout the employee life cycle.
Troubleshoot benefit-related issues to identify root cause and identify process improvements for the benefits program to include corrective actions and updates related to benefit operations to help streamline processes.
Partner with other HR staff members in support of processing enrollments, qualifying events, COBRA, and/or benefit changes. Also, will partner with HRIS on system specific updates and/or requirements.
Highly analytical and detail oriented in an effort to support Director of Benefits with reviewing, proposing and maintaining competitive, cost-efficient and legally compliant benefits.
Function as a benefits subject matter expert, reviewing and analyzing unique situations and recommending appropriate action after working with vendors and consultants on plan administration, issues with coverage and service.
Proactively identify issues within data or analyses and develop innovative solutions coordinate and complete reviews of all work to be presented as part of an audit process.
Maintain data integrity within the current HRIS system (Ceridian DayForce).
QUALIFICATIONS:

Associate degree required, Bachelor’s degree preferred. Human Resources, or other related/ analytical degree discipline.
Minimum of 5 - 7 years of benefits experience.
Strong database management, vendor management and communication skills both verbally and in writing are a must.
Working knowledge of Employee Benefit plans.
Demonstrated ability to analyze data and make recommendations.
Demonstrated ability to independently organize and perform work activities and to simultaneously handle multiple complex projects.
Ability to plan work and work on an individual basis as well as part of a team.
Strong computer skills, primarily with MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Word.
HRIS experience 3-5 years in DayForce / Workday (Considered) is required.

Job Title: Data Analyst - Digital Learning at UT
Job Description:
Data Analyst - Digital Learning at UT

- 23000002CZ


Data Analyst - Digital Learning at UT

Digital Learning at the University of Tennessee, Knoxville, is a newly created unit charged with advancing UT’s commitment to discovery, creativity, learning, and engagement, specifically for online learners. Using advanced and innovative technologies, Digital Learning at UT will provide scalable solutions that enhance the online learning experience and reduce barriers to student access and success, providing a tremendous impact to online learners across the state and the nation. At Digital Learning, we want to be bold and impactful, transforming the future of online education through innovative thinking and collaboration problem-solving.

As a Data Analyst, you will support the division by providing timely, accurate, and meaningful insights to decision makers. You will collect, analyze, and visualize data to help inform the decisions that shape the future of Digital Learning. Your focus will be the creation and maintenance of interactive dashboards that contain a variety of data visualizations and key performance indicators (KPls) designed to meet the needs of the end user and inform decisions at the highest levels of the division.


Your Specific Job Duties Will Be:

Data Analysis and Data Visualization

Work on a variety of projects analyzing marketing, admissions, enrollment, academic program, and other student data.
Design and maintain automated reports and interactive dashboards to inform business decisions using Microsoft Power BI, Google Looker, RStudio, Tableau, and other data visualization applications.
Organize results and conclusions of data analysis for use and presentation by departmental leaders.
Develop overall subject matter expertise regarding internal and external data sources that support departmental mission.
Provide guidance and technical advice to departmental customers in the areas of data visualization and reporting.
Remain current and learn new skills and software applications as tools and data analysis needs change over time.
Coordinate testing of new releases of data analysis and visualization applications to identify impacts to and across data libraries and/or databases to ensure data integrity.

Data Collection from Internal and External Data Sources

Design and maintain complex SQL queries to pull data from institutional relational databases that can be packaged as data sources for data analysis and visualizations. Join disparate data sources and establishes procedures to conduct regular data sampling and full data comparison on divisional and other data sets. Automate repetitive tasks by writing clean and tested code that can be maintained and extended by other analysts.
Contribute to data analysis and data visualization needs via ETL (extract, transform, load) procedures to translate raw data into user friendly formats, trend analyses, static and interactive graphs.
Collect and assist with the analysis of relevant data from external data sources such as the U.S. Department of Education Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System (IPEDS).
Merge data from external and internal databases and analyze correlations across merged data sets.
Use independent judgment to research and problem-solve data collection discrepancies and irregularities.

Implementation, Maintenance, and Documentation of the Internal Reporting Processes

Timely and accurate generation and dissemination of standard and on demand reports for use by departmental units. Must be able to respond ad hoc to requests accurately and quickly.
Automation of repetitive (standard) reports.
Consult with clients to understand data needs and develop tools to collect and deliver requested information.
Develop and maintain procedures to improve accuracy and efficiency of data querying, report generation, and data dissemination processes.
Identify data discrepancies and address data quality issues to ensure consistency and integrity of data collection and reporting.
Maintain departmental documentation for data definitions, a query catalog, sources of data and operation procedures for routine departmental processes.

Required Education and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Computational Social Science, or a related field.
Minimum of two (2) years of progressively responsible experience in data analysis and visualization, reporting, or statistical analysis.
Knowledge of data analysis and data visualization principles, practices, methods, and techniques. Demonstrated ability to work with large datasets, make correlations across multiple datasets, draw conclusions, and provide insights to various audiences.
Demonstrated skill in report and dashboard creation using data visualization tools like Power BI, Looker, or Tableau.
Demonstrated skill with SQL or a related programming language as well as data querying applications.
Demonstrated skill in Microsoft Office applications, primarily Excel.
Demonstrated skill in information presentation and document creation using software such as Microsoft PowerPoint, Adobe Acrobat and InDesign.
Demonstrated problem solving skills.
Strong record-keeping and organizational skills.
Ability to apply good attention to detail while maintaining university perspective.
Skill in effective communication, both verbal and written and including facilitating meetings and consensus building, working cooperatively with a variety of individuals.

Preferred Experience:

Master’s degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Computational Social Science, or a related field.

Summary:
The Data Quality Analyst plays a crucial role in ensuring that healthcare data is accurate, reliable, and compliant with industry regulations. Their primary responsibility is to maintain and improve the quality of healthcare data to support effective decision-making, patient care, and regulatory compliance. This position will work collaboratively with various departments and teams to ensure that data quality standards are met.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Data Validation and Quality Assurance: conduct regular audits and assessments of data to identify inaccuracies, inconsistencies, and data quality issues; Implement data validation processes and quality checks to ensure data accuracy and completeness; collaborate with business partners and data management/governance teams to resolve data quality issues promptly.
Continuous Quality Improvement: generate and maintain reports on data quality metrics, highlighting areas for improvement.; suggest, participate in, and implement data improvement initiatives, including data cleansing, validation, and enrichment processes; Keep up-to-date with industry standards, regulations, and best practices in data quality
Business Analysis and Quality Assurance: process incoming data-related requests working with requesters to development business requirements to create and/or modify existing datasets or data solutions; perform control checks for data development builds and assist in the integration of data from various sources and systems; perform advanced analysis to deliver quality issue root causes.
Data Quality Operations: maintain documentation related to data quality procedures and processes; ensure that data quality policies and guidelines are up-to-date and accessible to relevant stakeholders; provide training and guidance to staff members for appropriate data usage, data quality remediation efforts, and overall data management best practices.
Stakeholder Management: collaborate with key stakeholders, data technology leaders, business line colleagues, and product owners to understand data quality challenges; collaborate with third-party vendors and contractors for data-related services and solutions; build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders and organizational leadership.
Security, Privacy, and Compliance: shape data quality compliance controls and maintain data security and privacy standards; ensure that data quality controls comply with relevant regulations, including HIPAA, GDPR, and other healthcare data privacy and security standards; align data quality operations with data governance practices and standards to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with regulatory requirements
Data Matruity: participate regularly in data quality and governance initiatives to increase the accuracy and integrity of data within the enterprise data warehouse; create and support programs to increase data availability awareness and proper use and handling of organizational data as a company asset; regularly evaluate and manage data life cycles.




Minimum Qualifications:
Required Education: Bachelor's degree in Healthcare Information Management, Healthcare Informatics, Data Management, or a related field.
Preferred Education: Master's degree in Healthcare Information Management, Healthcare Informatics, Data Management, or a related field.

Required Experience:

Proven experience in data quality management, business analysis, data solution implementation, or related fields
Advanced knowledge of healthcare data/information workflows
Advanced knowledge of data ingestion and ETL/ELT processes
Advanced SQL programming experience
Advanced BI report development and BI workspace management
Preferred Experience:
2+ year experience in data quality management, business analysis, data solution implementation, or related fields
Strong experience with Google Data Platform data processing
Expert knowledge of healthcare data/information workflows
Expert knowledge of data ingestion and ETL/ELT processes
Expert SQL programming experience
Expert BI report development and BI workspace management

Preferred License/Registration/Certification:
CHDA (Certified Health Data Analyst, AHIMA); RHIA/RHIT (Registered Health Information Administrator, Registered Health Information Technician, AHIMA)

Computer Skills Required:
Gsuite and Microsoft Office Applications

The Employee may be required to occasionally climb, push, stand, walk, reach, grasp, kneel, stoop, and/or perform repetitive motions.
The Employee is not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions and; therefore, job functions are typically performed under conditions such as those found within general office or administrative work.

Overall Job Summary

This position is primarily responsible for pricing strategy, in-depth business analytics, financial reporting, and price optimization/management for assigned categories and channels using business intelligence and pricing analytics tools. The Pricing Analyst will work closely with the VP/DMM, Buying Teams, Manager of Pricing, and Director of Pricing to identify trends, monitor sales, margin and inventory turn performance, and forecast the impact of pricing actions across all categories and sales types. The Pricing Analyst is also responsible for analyzing competitor pricing, indexing our competitive position, and developing strategies to build market share in our competitive environment. The Pricing Analyst will also develop and lead special projects as requested by the Manager of Pricing or Director of Pricing.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities (Min 5%)
Analyze sales and margin performance and interpret customer and competitor behavior to provide guidance and recommendations for strategic pricing at the SKU, category, department, and Buying Team level across assigned categories, channels and sales types. Leverage competitive price information and market basket analysis to formulate price recommendations. Includes forecasts of changes in sales, margin, and unit performance with pricing recommendations.
Determine and recommend optimal, progressive clearance markdowns with consideration of clearance markdown strategy, budget and timing to VP/DMMs and Buying Teams. Includes forecasts of changes in sales, margin, and unit demand with markdown recommendations.
Enter and execute price changes into SAP, Price Optimization software and other systems.
Develop and maintain analysis for use in monitoring and reviewing SKU, category, department, and Buying Team level financial results compared to budget and LY across all sales types. Identifies trends and leverages analysis to formulate future plans and forecasts.
Examine and analyze the impact and implication of cost as a driver of price. Integrates with Buying teams and other functional departments, becoming the subject matter expert on price and cost in assigned categories, channels and sales types.

Required Qualifications

Experience: 2-4 years of experience in financial analysis, business analysis, category management, merchandise planning, or other retail/business analytics required, with 1-3 years of pricing management or optimization experience preferred

Education: Bachelor's degree required. MBA or other advanced degree in a related field (Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Business, Marketing, Economics, or the equivalent) strongly preferred. Any suitable combination of education and experience will be considered.


Preferred knowledge, skills or abilities
Advanced Excel skills (required)
Ability to build sophisticated financial and statistical models, analyze data, and translate analysis into specific, targeted action to drive results (required)
Proficiency in working with complex and large volumes of data (required)
Ability to persuasively present complex ideas, analysis, and projects to executives and large groups (required)
Ability to master complex software platforms such as Business Intelligence, Competitive Intelligence, and Pricing Analytics (Required)

Working Conditions
Normal office working conditions

Sitting
Standing (not walking)
Walking
Lifting up to 10 pounds

Summary

The Senior Pricing Analyst is an internal consultant for the merchandising department. This individual will be responsible for supporting pricing integrity (price accuracy) and implementation across the entire pricing lifecycle including initial pricing, everyday pricing, price tests and markdown/clearance pricing. This role is directly responsible for using data-driven analytics to develop insights to strengthen pricing strategy recommendations. The Senior Pricing Analyst supports Category Management teams by data mining and presenting findings as they build merchandising strategies. This position requires strong math skills, as well as a demonstration of strong analysis skills with a keen sense of business acumen.

Responsibilities

Develop and present opportunities to increase profitability and/or sales through pricing initiatives.
Regularly consult with category managers (CMs) on business needs and make pricing recommendations to support objectives.
Analyze data in price optimization software and develop scenarios to recommend every day and price test recommendations.
Apply data-driven analytics to evaluate the marketplace and competitive data to optimally align pricing strategies within the chain and store-specific zones.
Monitor and evaluate the day-to-day pricing activities across multiple merchandise categories; develop tools/reports to communicate pricing trends.
Measure success of pricing change activity to ensure the team meets company expectations while maintaining stated and approved pricing philosophies.
Assume a leadership role for broader departmental responsibilities and projects.
Support and mentor other team members.
Solve problems through data analysis and reporting.
Review and establish best practices for the team.




Requirements

A Bachelor’s degree (BA, BS) or equivalent in Business Administrations, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or comparable field
Three to five years of experience preferred in Business Administrations, Price Optimization, Statistics, Engineering, or Merchandising related responsibilities
Knowledge of and interest in activity-based costing, factor analysis, microeconomics, statistical process control, business process analysis, continuous improvement, and business modeling using such techniques as linear regression, experiments, and time series forecasting
Understanding of database structures; query writing skills a plus
Excellent interpersonal skills, communication skills and the ability to work with/contribute to a team

About Gelfand, Rennert & Feldman
Founded in 1967, Gelfand, Rennert & Feldman ("GRF") is a leading full-service business management firm for an exclusive assortment of entertainers, executives and select high net worth individuals. Our 30 partners and over 600 staff members deliver comprehensive financial services in the fields of music, motion pictures, television, sports, literature, and other creative and performing arts. Our firm has offices in Los Angeles, New York City, Nashville, San Rafael, Wilmington, and London.

We are seeking a Music Royalty Analyst to join our team of dedicated professionals.

Location: This position can be based out of Nashville (TN), or else New York City or White Plains (NY).

Overview of Role: The primary responsibility of this role is to assist the department in conducting compliance examinations on behalf of our entertainment clients and other rights holders.

Responsibilities:

Assist managers with music royalty audits of record companies, music publishers, and merchandising companies, on behalf of clients that include many Multi-Platinum and Grammy-winning artists, writers, and producers
Download and summarize royalty statements
Review and summarize music industry contracts (recording, publishing, etc.)
Combine and format large electronic datasets
Maintain organization of electronic files and folders
Analyze data to find underpayments of royalties and create claim schedules
Assist with fieldwork (currently done remotely)
Conduct Internet research

A successful candidate will possess the following qualifications:

Bachelor's degree (in Accounting, Economics, Finance, Statistics, Analytics, Music Business or another related field) is required
Advanced proficiency in Excel, including Pivot Tables and formulas (such as VLOOKUP and SUMIF) – bonus points for experience with Power Pivot and Power Query
Solid interpersonal skills and other key soft skills (i.e., communication, time management, emotional intelligence, adaptability, active listening, critical-thinking, etc.)
A genuine interest in the music business and music royalties
The candidate must also:
Be a self-motivated and detail-oriented analytical thinker
Possess excellent verbal/written communication skills and reading comprehension
Understand basic mathematical and accounting principles
Work well independently and in a team environment
Be eager to learn new skills and concepts
Want to help creative artists
While not required, experience or education in the music business, particularly music royalties and music royalty audits are beneficial

Job Title: DASH HCM Business Analyst, Department of Technology Solutions - UT System
Company Name: University of Tennessee Health Science Center
Job Description:
DASH HCM Business Analyst, Department of Technology Solutions - UT System

- 23000001M6


Market Range 09
This position is located in Knoxville, TN, and offers a hybrid work schedule.

About the UT System
The University of Tennessee is comprised of campuses at Knoxville, Chattanooga, Martin, and Pulaski; the Health Science Center at Memphis; the Space Institute at Tullahoma; and the statewide Institute of Agriculture and Institute for Public Service.

The UT System has a presence in each of Tennessee’s 95 counties. Through the combined force of education, research and outreach, the University serves students, business and industry, schools, governments, organizations, and citizens statewide.

The Opportunity

The Department of Technology Solutions enthusiastically invites applications for the position of DASH HCM Business Analyst to join our talented team of IT professionals.The University of Tennessee System is currently preparing for a transition to a new, cloud-based enterprise resource planning (ERP) system, known as DASH (Dynamic Administrative Systems for Higher Ed). This position will play a critical role in preparing for the go-live of finance, human resources, and payroll functions to a new Oracle Fusion Cloud platform scheduled to launch in the summer of 2024.

Duties and Responsibilities

The HCM Business Analyst will identify and analyze the University's needs in terms of ERP software, including Financial Systems, Human Resources, Payroll, Materials Management, Real Estate, and other related modules.

Additionally, the position will direct and participate in the complex and mission-critical technical analysis, design, modification/development, testing, and documenting of complex software solutions (purchased software, in-house developed custom software, software modifications, and interfaces) that execute independently or as part of a larger information system.

Specific duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Analyze and integrate with other software systems, both internal and external to the University
Configure, test, document, implement and modify assigned modules of the ERP
Provide end-user support and training for assigned modules
Identify deficiencies in the ERP software, including error corrections, new development, and making recommendations for improvements
Advise and assist University management in the execution of their duties as related to the ERP


Required Qualifications

An associate degree with at least one year of software support experience OR an equivalent combination of education and experience to include work with higher education ERP or Student Information Systems is required.

The following skills, abilities, and professional attributes are also required:

Strategic technology planning experience
The ability to understand and configure complex computerized accounting systems
Strong analytical skills with the ability to think critically and generate solutions
Knowledge of payroll and human resources functions
The ability to advocate for change and build relationships with a variety of stakeholders
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
The ability to interact effectively with technical and non-technical staff regarding needs and requirements for specified tasks
Customer-service oriented with the ability to translate user requirements into a deliverable product independently with minimal technical supervision
Detail-oriented with the ability to focus on completing tasks in a deadline-driven environment
Motivated, independent, and a self-starter with a proactive, future-focused orientation

Preferred Qualifications

The following skills, credentials, and experiences are preferred but not required:

A bachelor’s degree
Oracle or Microsoft data-related or report developer certifications
Oracle Fusion Cloud ERP configuration and/or support experience
Experience with reporting tools such as Oracle Transactional Business Intelligence (OTBI), Oracle BI Publisher, Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE), or Microsoft Power BI

Application Process




For full consideration, applications should be accompanied by a letter of interest, a resume, and three professional references. Review of applications will begin immediately.

Benefits and Compensation

Compensation for the position will be competitive and commensurate with qualifications and experience within the market range.

The University offers a comprehensive benefits package that includes excellent healthcare and tuition benefits for employees and their families, generous retirement benefits, a wide variety of professional development opportunities, supportive work and family benefits and much more. Additionally, Tennessee residents do not pay a state income tax. For more information on the University of Tennessee’s benefits, visit https://hr.tennessee.edu/benefits/

About Us

A few years ago, our intrepid team of nurses, doctors, developers, salespeople and data scientists came to a realization: if we can truly put the power of data and technology behind the clinical expertise of nurses and docs, we can transform the future of healthcare. Right now, we’re focused on bridging the silos that afflict the industry with inefficiency, waste, and friction, ultimately refocusing healthcare towards the patient, not the process.

We offer a Software as a Solution (SaaS) platform that connects previously disparate data from within an electronic medical record and transforms it into the type of clinical insight that can help providers determine appropriate care and reimbursement.

Additionally, this platform is used as a conduit to connect the provider to the payer, helping break down the information silos that result in denied claims, administrative burden, and strained relationships.

And to be clear: it’s working! We are expanding to help support our mission, our growth, and our clients. We’re looking for smart, savvy, spirited people like you to join the movement.
Position Summary
As a key member of Xsolis’ Product Team, the Growth Analyst will play a crucial role in carrying out market and financial analysis to inform our investment strategy and prioritization. You will gather and analyze data to understand market size, growth potential, target audiences, and competitive landscape. You will develop financial models and investment forecasts, and you will use a financial-savvy mindset and storytelling to effectively convey information to validate product ideas and make informed investment decisions. Your work will directly contribute to our company's growth and success.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
The essential functions include, but are not limited to the following:
Market Analysis: Analyze market sizing, market value, market demand, and market need metrics to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
Customer Analysis: Analyze user data, customer attitudes, and purchasing behaviors to understand customer base and define needs of unique customer segments.
Competitive Analysis: Stay informed about industry trends and competitors to identify opportunities for differentiation and growth.
Forecasting: Utilize historical data and predictive modeling to forecast future capture rate, growth, and revenue.
Financial Modeling: Leverage financial models and financial storytelling to provide a decision-making framework for evaluating, prioritizing, and communicating product investments.
Business Cases: Create, distribute, and ensure alignment of investment business cases, financial cases, and ROIs and manage business case changes, iterations, and versions.
Reporting and Insights: Create regular reports and dashboards to communicate key performance metrics related to product investment, growth, and ROI.
Collaboration: Collaborate with product, finance, sales, and marketing teams to align growth strategies with business objectives. Understand the business as a whole and take ownership in becoming a partner in informing data-driven decisions, not simply an order taker.
Project Management: Responsible for managing multiple projects, and collaborating with stakeholders to drive initiatives forward.
Pricing Strategy: Establish product pricing strategy informed by cost, value, and market tolerance. Work with finance to implement in CPQ. Maintain product price book.

Summary:
